LayoutNode.Content: 36th International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science The series of MFCS symposia, organized in rotation by Poland, Slovakia, and the Czech Republic since 1972, has a long and well-established tradition. The MFCS symposia encourage high-quality research in all branches of theoretical computer science. Their broad scope provides an opportunity to bring together researchers who do not usually meet at specialized conferences. As in the last year, Young Researchers Forum will be organized in August 22-24 as an event associated with MFCS: http://mfcs.mimuw.edu.pl/yrf Venue The MFCS 2011 conference will be held on August 22-26, 2011 in the old library of the University of Warsaw, Krakowskie Przedmieście 26/28, in the center of Warsaw. MFCS 2010 proceedings will be published by Springer-Verlag in the new ARCoSS subline of Lecture Notes in Computer Science as Volume 6907. Organizers MFCS 2011 is organized by the Polish Mathematical Society in cooperation with EATCS. Deadlines Full papers: April 15, 2011 Notification: May 30, 2011 Final version: June 13, 2011 Contact MFCS 2011 PC chairs: Filip Murlak & Piotr Sankowski
LayoutNode.SRC:
36th International Symposium on Mathematical Foundations of Computer Science

The series of MFCS symposia, organized in rotation by Poland, Slovakia, and the Czech Republic since 1972, has a long and well-established tradition. The MFCS symposia encourage high-quality research in all branches of theoretical computer science. Their broad scope provides an opportunity to bring together researchers who do not usually meet at specialized conferences.

As in the last year, Young Researchers Forum will be organized in August 22-24 as an event associated with MFCS: http://mfcs.mimuw.edu.pl/yrf

Venue

The MFCS 2011 conference will be held on August 22-26, 2011 in the old library of the University of Warsaw, Krakowskie Przedmieście 26/28, in the center of Warsaw. MFCS 2010 proceedings will be published by Springer-Verlag in the new ARCoSS subline of Lecture Notes in Computer Science as Volume 6907.

Organizers

MFCS 2011 is organized by the Polish Mathematical Society in cooperation with EATCS.

Deadlines

  • Full papers: April 15, 2011
  • Notification: May 30, 2011
  • Final version: June 13, 2011

Contact

  • MFCS 2011 PC chairs: Filip Murlak & Piotr Sankowski
